meanings.definition: To make something seem more attractive or exciting than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She was glamorizing her weekend plans to her friends.
meanings.sent2: The magazine cover was glamorizing the celebrity's lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help glamorizing his boring chores with a touch of imagination.
meanings.sent4: The movie director was glamorizing the harsh reality of life on screen.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement was glamorizing the benefits of the new product.

meanings.definition: To make something appear glamorous or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The fashion designer was glamorizing the latest collection for the runway show.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent was glamorizing the luxurious features of the house.
meanings.sent3: The chef was glamorizing the simple dish with elegant presentation.
meanings.sent4: The artist was glamorizing the cityscape with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The influencer was glamorizing the travel destination in her posts.
